Diagnosis
	1. Lipid-rich carcinoma of left breast, T4N3aM1
	   Date of diagnosis
	   October 2023
	   Treatment aim
	   Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	Not indicated - metastatic at presentation

	Chemotherapy
	1. TCHP (Docetaxel/Carboplatin/Herceptin/Perjeta) commenced 11/2023
	2. Discontinued after 4 cycles due to disease progression 02/2024

	Radiotherapy
	20Gy in 5# to symptomatic T7 metastasis completed 12/2023

	Current disease status
	Progressive disease with new liver metastases

	Current issues
	1. Deteriorating mobility
	2. Increasing bone pain
	3. New liver metastases

	Summary of consultation
	Unfortunately [redacted name]'s disease has progressed despite initial TCHP chemotherapy. CT scan from 15/03/24 shows new liver metastases and progression in bone disease. Her mobility has deteriorated significantly, now requiring wheelchair for most activities. Pain control is suboptimal despite recent increase in opioids.

Performance status has declined to ECOG 3. Examination shows tender hepatomegaly and new ascites. Bloods show rising liver enzymes (ALT 156, ALP 345) and falling albumin of 28.

	Further investigations
	Urgent MRI liver to assess extent of new metastases

	Medication prescribed
	1. Increased MST to 60mg BD
	2. Added dexamethasone 4mg BD

	Follow up
	Next oncology follow up in 1 week with MRI results

	Required GP actions
	Please monitor renal function and electrolytes

	Summary of information given to patient
	Discussed disease progression and changing treatment to TDM1. Explained rationale and likely side effects. Patient understands palliative intent of ongoing care.
